Posts.Content: May 18, 2011 06:54AM WorkingMom10 wrote: Thank you so much for your responses.  I am nervous about my MRI next week and am hoping that there is no other cancer found.  One question I do have is do I need an oncologist in addition to my surgeon?  The oncologist I saw was for a second opinion and she did not work directly with my surgeon.  I live about 3 hours away from my doctors and it would be difficult to have to take sick leave from my job for 2 months to have radiation.  Can you tell me more about the mammosite treatments?  Do they take less time?  How effective are they compared to the traditional radiation treatments? The waiting is so hard and I wish I lived closer to the doctors, but I am willing to do what needs to be done to take care of myself.

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2018 03:41PM WorkingMom10 wrote: I had a very similar situation happen. I felt a pop in my hip and after enduring pain for almost 6 weeks, I learned that my hip had broken due to bone Mets. I had a rod inserted in my left femur and a pin placed in my hip. I’m sure my femur would have broken at some point. I’ve been NED since April 2017 and I get monthly Zometa infusions to strengthen my bones
Posts.Title: Titanium rod chef47 chef47

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 10:31AM WorkingMom10 wrote: I just had a lumpectomy on my right breast last week and the margins did not come back clear.  My BS is now recommending a mastectomy on my right breast.  I am now debating whether or not to have just the right breast removed or both.  I got this news yesterday and am leaning toward the bilateral just for peace of mind.  I would appreciate any advice you can share on the pros and cons of bilateral vs unilateral mx for DCIS.  What additional treatment would be required after both procedures?  Should I see a medical oncologist before making a final decision?  Thanks!
Posts.Title: Bilateral vs. Unilateral Mastectomy WorkingMom10 habbott

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2011 12:44PM - edited Jun 22, 2011 12:45PM by WorkingMom10 Thank you everyone for your feedback.  I met with my breast surgeon a couple days ago and with my reconstruction surgeon last week.  I decided to go with the bilateral mastectomy and DIEP reconstruction.  My doctors are all great and helped me understand the surgery and recovery process.  I want to have the peace of mind that I am not waiting for the other shoe to drop in the future if I only had the breast with the DCIS removed.  I am nervous about the recovery process, but I am grateful that I am a candidate for the DIEP procedure and that this should be the end of my treatment.  My BS said that there is a rare chance that there could be some cancer cells in my nodes, so she is going to do a node biopsy too. Christine
Posts.Title: Bilateral vs. Unilateral Mastectomy WorkingMom10 habbott
